video.title: Bill Nye The Science Guy
video.synopsis: Host Bill Nye gets kids fired up about science, sharing his enthusiasm for all its branches, from astronomy to complex ideas about genetics.

episodes.synopsis: Bill digs deep, venturing into the depths of the Earth to reveal the differences between Earth's surface and its inner mantle.
episodes.title: Earth's Crust

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy explores the force that holds the ocean on the Earth and makes our planet round while explaining these and other phenomena of gravity.
episodes.title: Gravity

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy explains the wonders of the body's digestive system and how it works like a finely tuned machine to turn food into energy.
episodes.title: Digestion

episodes.synopsis: Bill Nye has a blast sharing explosive demonstrations and explaining how everything in existence is made up of chemicals.
episodes.title: Chemical Reactions

episodes.synopsis: Bill reveals unexpected sources of magnetism, including the Earth itself, which is actually one huge magnet. He also explains how opposites attract.
episodes.title: Magnetism

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy gets tangled in a complex food web on his quest to show that all living things depend on each other to survive.
episodes.title: Food Web

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy reflects, refracts, bends, bounces, absorbs and pulls light waves to show how things can be seen in different ways.
episodes.title: Light Optics

episodes.synopsis: Bill sheds light on solar flares, eclipses, sunspots, fusion and solar energy. He also visits an enormous solar energy farm in California.
episodes.title: The Sun

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy talks about the atmosphere, its five different levels and how it protects the Earth. Later, he explores air pressure and radio waves.
episodes.title: Atmosphere

episodes.synopsis: Bill gets aerobic about the importance of respiration when he jogs, bikes, swims and scuba dives. He also demonstrates how to construct a model lung.
episodes.title: Respiration

episodes.synopsis: Bill shares some wild facts about plants, including how they breathe, make food, defend themselves and move their seeds.
episodes.title: Plants

episodes.synopsis: Bill compares the primordial to the present when he dabbles with Darwin and looks at his own genes, all while examining evolutionary theory.
episodes.title: Evolution

episodes.synopsis: Bill shows how various forms of transportation use friction, from traction in trains and ball bearings in cars to the friction-less hovercraft.
episodes.title: Friction

episodes.synopsis: Bill Nye delivers sand from Saudi Arabia and bananas from Costa Rica to show how climates are created and how they affect our planet.
episodes.title: Climates

episodes.synopsis: Bill goes planet-gazing and takes a serious look at Jupiter's features, Earth's elliptical orbit and the distances between planets.
episodes.title: The Planets

episodes.synopsis: Bill goes underwater to talk about ocean ecosystems and the importance of organisms such as coral, plankton and kelp.
episodes.title: Ocean Life

episodes.synopsis: Marine mammals look like big fish, but Bill shows how they're a lot like humans, using complex underwater "language" and adaptive skills to survive.
episodes.title: Mammals

episodes.synopsis: From a peep of chickens and a pride of lions to a gaggle of geese and a crowd of people, Bill explores how populations compete for precious resources.
episodes.title: Populations

episodes.synopsis: Bill Nye checks out a millipede that walks by coordinating the motions of its 200 feet, along with creatures who move without a leg to stand on.
episodes.title: Animal Locomotion

episodes.synopsis: Bill explains relative motion and why nothing can move or stop by itself, demonstrating the forces that push and pull what's in and around us.
episodes.title: Motion

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy explains what makes big pieces of the Earth's crust move and what to do in the event of an earthquake.
episodes.title: Earthquakes

episodes.synopsis: Bill explains the critical need for all humans to prepare for the future by searching for answers to the world's pollution problems.
episodes.title: Pollution Solutions

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy simplifies the complicated concept of probability and shows how it helps people predict the likelihood of important events.
episodes.title: Probability

episodes.synopsis: Bill and Drew Barrymore show that there's a lot more to flowers than just beauty. They make seeds, aid in pollination and help other plants reproduce.
episodes.title: Flowers

episodes.synopsis: Bill Nye travels to Arizona's stunning Sonoran Desert to explore its unique ecosystem and show how its native plants and animals flourish.
episodes.title: Deserts

episodes.synopsis: Bill shows this vital muscular pump's function by pulling nine G's with the U.S. Navy's Blue Angels and chatting with baseball's Edgar Martinez.
episodes.title: Heart

episodes.synopsis: Not all inventions are carefully planned; some valuable ones arise by accident. Actor Samuel L. Jackson helps Bill examine the process of inventing.
episodes.title: Inventions

episodes.synopsis: Bill explores the chromosomal world of DNA and visits a veterinarian who uses gene technology to help save endangered animals.
episodes.title: Genes

episodes.synopsis: Offering a lesson in "do-it-yourself science," the Science Guy shows viewers how they can conduct their own scientific experiments.
episodes.title: Do-It-Yourself Science

episodes.synopsis: Where does the water that fills Earth's lakes and ponds come from? Bill ponders this and other questions about the fresh water we need to live.
episodes.title: Lakes & Ponds

episodes.synopsis: The Science Guy explains the value of storms and how, without them, large regions of the Earth would be too hot or too cold to inhabit.
episodes.title: Storms
